alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 11:54AM EDT until March 26 at 3:33AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Forecast flooding increased in duration for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County. .Heavy rain from the past 24 hours has caused the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rough River near Dundee. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads between Dundee and Narrows flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 25.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued tonight.
